trans-unit.source: Make sure to stop the mobile service if it is currently running in IIS Express.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to stop the mobile service if it is currently running in IIS Express.

trans-unit.source: Right click the IIS Express tray icon and click stop for the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Right click the IIS Express tray icon and click stop for the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In a command prompt window, run the ipconfig command to look up a valid local IP address for your workstation.
trans-unit.target: In a command prompt window, run the ipconfig command to look up a valid local IP address for your workstation.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the applicationhost.config file for IIS Express.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the applicationhost.config file for IIS Express.

trans-unit.source: This file is located in the following subdirectory of your user profile directory.
trans-unit.target: This file is located in the following subdirectory of your user profile directory.

trans-unit.source: Configure IIS Express to allow remote connection requests to the service.
trans-unit.target: Configure IIS Express to allow remote connection requests to the service.

trans-unit.source: To do this, in the applicationhost.config file, find the site element for your mobile service and add a new binding element for the port using the IP address you noted above.
trans-unit.target: To do this, in the applicationhost.config file, find the site element for your mobile service and add a new binding element for the port using the IP address you noted above.

trans-unit.source: Your updated site element should look similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: Your updated site element should look similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Open the Windows Firewall console and create a new port rule to allow connections to the port.
trans-unit.target: Open the Windows Firewall console and create a new port rule to allow connections to the port.

trans-unit.source: For more information on creating a new Windows Firewall port rule, see [How to add a new Windows Firewall port rule].
trans-unit.target: For more information on creating a new Windows Firewall port rule, see [How to add a new Windows Firewall port rule].

trans-unit.source: If your test machine is joined to a domain, firewall exceptions may be controlled by a domain policy.
trans-unit.target: If your test machine is joined to a domain, firewall exceptions may be controlled by a domain policy.

trans-unit.source: In this case, you would need to contact your domain adminstrator to get an exemption for the port on your machine.
trans-unit.target: In this case, you would need to contact your domain adminstrator to get an exemption for the port on your machine.

trans-unit.source: You should now be configured to test with IIS Express hosting your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: You should now be configured to test with IIS Express hosting your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Once you finish your testing of the service locally, you should delete the Windows Firewall rule you created.
trans-unit.target: Once you finish your testing of the service locally, you should delete the Windows Firewall rule you created.
